item.title: Courtney add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The Guide says there is an art to flying", said Ford, "or rather a knack. The knack lies in learning how to throw yourself at the ground and miss." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Courtney add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The more I know of the world, the more I am convinced that I shall never see a man whom I can really love. I require so much!" -- Jane Austen

item.title: Courtney add a quote by Studs Terkel
item.description: "Work is about a search for daily meaning as well as daily bread, for recognition as well as cash, for astonishment rather than torpor; in short, for a sort of life rather than a Monday through Friday sort of dying." -- Studs Terkel

item.title: Courtney add a quote by Elizabeth Peters
item.description: "No woman really wants a man to carry her off; she only wants him to want to do it." -- Elizabeth Peters

item.title: Courtney add a quote by Elizabeth Peters
item.description: "Marriage, in my view, should be a balanced stalemate between equal adversaries." -- Elizabeth Peters

item.title: Courtney add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "Paranoid? Probably. But just because you're paranoid doesn't mean there isn't an invisible demon about to eat your face." -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Courtney add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "This is a good sign, having a broken heart. It means we have tried for something." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Courtney add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "To be prosperous and happy in life, Henry, it is simple. Pick one woman, pick it well, and surrender." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Courtney add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "Who loves you most? Who loves you best? Who thinks of you when others rest?" -- Elizabeth Gilbert
